sourceMeaningMnemonic: An <radical>axe</radical> is sticking in the <radical>ground</radical> on top of a <radical>mountain</radical>. It's sticking into the very <kanji>peak</kanji>. Because why would you bother to stick your axe anywhere else on the mountain to prove you climbed it?
meaningInfo: Picture that axe, jammed into the mountain's <kanji>peak</kanji>. The person who did that must have been really cool to get all the way up there.
readingMnemonic: You can't help but <reading>gawk</reading> (<ja>がく</ja>) at the <kanji>peak</kanji>. Somehow it looks even higher now.
readingInfo: Go ahead, imagine this peak with an axe in it and actually gawk a bit at how far you have to go to get that high.
